info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 23 at 8:55PM EDT until March 24 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion Henderson County in Western North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 855 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated lingering heavy rain due to thunderstorms which will aggravate already saturated ground conditions. This is especially likely throughout the Green River basin, across Greater Hendersonville and across select tributaries of the French Broad River. Storm total rainfall amounts have averaged in the 3 to 4 inches across a large portion of the county. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hendersonville, Flat Rock, Mountain Home, Laurel Park, Dupont State Forest, Valley Hill, East Flat Rock, Dana, Tuxedo, Crab Creek and Edneyville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
